To answer this question, we need to consider the natural habitat and adaptations of each animal listed. Arctic environments are characterized by extremely cold temperatures, icy conditions, and lack of vegetation. 

Option (A) iguanas are reptiles that are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. They are adapted to warm climates and would not find the Arctic environment pleasant.

Option (B) parka squirrels are not a real animal, so we can eliminate this option.

Option (C) tiger sharks are marine animals that are typically found in warmer ocean waters. They would not be able to survive or thrive in the cold Arctic environment.

Option (D) Burmese pythons are native to Southeast Asia and are not adapted to cold climates. They would not find the arctic environment pleasant.

Therefore, the only option remaining is (B) parka squirrels, which is the most suitable answer.

This question requires some knowledge about the natural habitats and preferences of different animals. Out of the given options, parka squirrels would find an arctic environment most pleasant. They are adapted to cold temperatures and have thick fur coats to keep warm. Iguanas (option A) are cold-blooded reptiles and prefer warm tropical environments. Tiger sharks (option C) are ocean-dwelling predators and do not inhabit arctic environments. Burmese pythons (option D) are native to Southeast Asia and prefer tropical or subtropical habitats.

Iguanas are native to tropical environments and would not find the Arctic environment pleasant. Parka squirrels, on the other hand, are specifically adapted to cold climates and have thick fur and a specialized metabolism that allows them to survive and thrive in the Arctic. Therefore, parka squirrels would find an arctic environment most pleasant.
